feed.title: Combined summary - Bitcoin-development Digest, Vol 35, Issue 61

entry.title: Combined summary - Bitcoin-development Digest, Vol 35, Issue 61
entry.summary: The email thread centers around the security issues related to Windows XP and its use with Bitcoin wallets. Adam Back expresses doubt about Windows' security, stating that it was vulnerable even during its support period, making it prone to remote root compromises or user compromises.To enhance the security of one's system, he suggests installing off-line, using a software firewall, and connecting behind a router with no port forwarding. The discussion also emphasizes the significance of knowledge and skill in operating a computer, along with the need for defensive driving and computing practices.The email includes a link to NetMarketShare's data on the market share for mobile, browsers, operating systems, search engines, and social media.
